title: Does State Administration Fit Regional Reality?
prompt: A worn topographic map spread across a wooden table in morning light, showing state boundary lines in bold colors that visibly contradict the natural contours and shaded relief of actual terrainâ€”Appalachian ridgelines, river valleys, and geographic features bleeding across multiple state borders. A hand (no face visible) points to or traces along one of these misaligned boundaries. Soft golden-hour side-lighting emphasizes the creases and aging of the paper map itself. The composition should feel like documentary photography of an actual policy meeting or analysis workspace, capturing the tactile evidence of administrative boundaries struggling against physical geography. Muted greens, browns, and blues of the map against weathered wood, with shallow depth of field keeping focus on the intersection of human gesture and cartographic contradiction.
